projectPurpose: To provide an open-source, self-hosted web user interface for interacting with large language models like ChatGPT, built using the Rust programming language and the HTMX web development approach, emphasizing performance and a specific technology stack.
mainFeatures: SQLite database with compile-time query verification

alternatives.name: Claude
mainFeatures: Focus on helpful, honest, and harmless conversations

alternatives.name: LobeChat
alternatives.license: Open Source - MIT w/ license exception [9]
mainFeatures: Modern UI supporting multiple AI providers

alternatives.name: Open WebUI
mainFeatures: Supports Ollama, OpenAI, and other APIs

marketPositioning: RustGPT is positioned as an open-source, self-hosted web UI for LLMs, specifically highlighting its foundation in the Rust programming language and HTMX for a performance-oriented and architecturally distinct alternative to mainstream proprietary AI interfaces (like ChatGPT, Gemini) and other open-source UIs (often built with JavaScript frameworks). It targets users and developers seeking transparency, control, and an interest in the Rust/HTMX technology stack, offering a more focused feature set initially compared to broader platforms like LobeChat or Jan which support more models and features out-of-the-box but use different underlying technologies.
